title: BJP’s Bihar allies in a fix over support for Waqf law, RJD spots a line of attack
story_summary: Bihar's BJP allies, JD(U) and LJP (Ram Vilas), face backlash over supporting the Waqf Amendment Bill amid upcoming Assembly elections. The RJD aims to consolidate its Muslim base, criticizing Nitish Kumar's secular image. Several JD(U) Muslim leaders have quit in protest. Chirag Paswan defends his support, citing his father's legacy of fighting for minorities. The Waqf law is viewed as progressive, but some leaders remain displeased. Social Justice parties risk losing minority support, while the RJD aims to capitalize on the controversy. The RJD frames the law as a constitutional issue.

title: Why Raj Thackeray may have directed MNS workers to halt Marathi language stir
story_summary: MNS chief Raj Thackeray halted his Marathi language campaign after facing backlash. The BJP fears antagonizing its North Indian voter base before Bihar elections. Reports of MNS activists assaulting non-Marathi speakers emerged. Bank unions raised objections, citing threats to officials. Industries expressed concerns, fearing impact on Maharashtra's trillion-dollar economy target. Fadnavis reassured safety and upholding the law. The state aims to attract global investors. The MNS campaign risked violence and industry withdrawal.

title: CPI(M) hits refresh: Old guard out, new leaders in, but the big challenges remain
story_summary: CPI(M) elected M A Baby as general secretary, ushering in new Politburo members, replacing veterans with leaders under 75, except Pinarayi Vijayan. The Party Congress revealed divisions with a rare Central Committee election. Karat, Brinda, Sarkar, and Ali are now special invitees. The new Central Committee includes 30 new members. Baby faces challenges revitalizing the CPI(M) in West Bengal and Tripura, making inroads in the Northeast, and retaining power in Kerala. The party's mass base and electoral footprint have declined. Baby aims to counter the BJP and expand the CPI(M)'s strength.

title: Today in Politics: Rahul to join Kanhaiya’s yatra in Bihar; Amit Shah to hold high-level security review meet in Srinagar
story_summary: Rahul Gandhi to join Kanhaiya Kumar's march in Begusarai, Bihar, advocating for jobs and halting migration. He encourages youth participation and pressure on the government. Amit Shah to hold a security review in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, and visit the International Border at Kathua. Karnataka BJP to launch a 16-day movement against price rise and Muslim reservation. The movement is planned in four phases across the state.

title: KTR interview: ‘Revanth Reddy has no regard for the law … turned Telangana into an Emergency state’
story_summary: BRS leader K T Rama Rao criticizes Telangana CM Revanth Reddy over land auction near Hyderabad University. He welcomes Supreme Court's stay order and accuses the Congress government of insensitivity. KTR claims the government disregards environmental impact assessment. He alleges Reddy faces the Supreme Court's wrath and lacks regard for the law. He accuses the government of filing cases against BRS leaders. The Congress promised guarantees before the election but now claims there's no money. KTR says Telangana is intellectually, not financially, bankrupt.

title: CPI(M) appoints new general secretary: Who is M A Baby?
story_summary: M A Baby elected CPI(M) general secretary, succeeding Prakash Karat. Baby is the second Kerala leader after E M S Namboodiripad to hold the post. Born in Kollam, he's a self-proclaimed atheist and cultural ambassador. Started with Kerala Students Federation, became SFI's national president. Jailed during the Emergency.  Entered Rajya Sabha in 1986. Served as Kerala Education Minister. Known for interest in music, cinema, and literature. Faces challenge of reviving CPI(M) in West Bengal and Tripura.

title: PM Modi and RSS chief Bhagwat’s meeting steadies the boat, clears the air
story_summary: PM Modi visited RSS headquarters in Nagpur, meeting with Mohan Bhagwat, signaling reconciliation after tensions. Modi reaffirmed his identity as a swayamsevak, bowing to the RSS ideology. The visit underscored BJP's continued need for RSS support. It addressed RSS grievances with the government.  Bhagwat and Modi discussed various issues including concerns on rising right wing forces. The meeting aimed to stabilize the relationship and ensure collaboration for the future.  They aim for greater stability in the minority BJP government.

title: Kerala’s M A Baby named next CPM general secretary
story_summary: M A Baby was unveiled as the next CPI(M) national general secretary, succeeding Prakash Karat. Baby, a former Kerala education minister, rose through the party ranks. A section of leaders suggested Ashok Dhawale for the post. Karat had been handling party affairs in an interim capacity since Sitaram Yechury’s death. The party also inducted eight new Polit Bureau members. Baby believes the CPI(M) needs to regain its mass appeal.  The party's footprint is currently restricted to Kerala. Vijayan supported Baby’s candidature.

title: BJD MP on the party’s Waqf shift: ‘Naveen Patnaik’s advisor is behind it… there is a secret deal with BJP’
story_summary: BJD faces internal conflict over its Waqf Amendment Bill stance; MP Debashish Samantaray abstained from voting in protest. Samantaray alleges Naveen Patnaik's advisor influenced the shift, suggesting a secret deal with the BJP. Patnaik had previously committed to opposing the Bill, raising questions about the sudden change. Senior BJD leaders allege a conspiracy and call for an investigation. Samantaray fears the Waqf row could impact BJD's minority vote base, accusing the party of a dual stand. He says Muslim community was not consulted on Waqf legislation.

title: Knives out in Haryana Congress against Hooda as Hariprasad steps up rehaul bid
story_summary: Haryana Congress faces factionalism and lacks organizational structure after recent election defeat. AICC in-charge B K Hariprasad aims to rebuild the party and voices against Hooda’s leadership grow louder. Leaders demand Udai Bhan's resignation and seek a change in party leadership. Hariprasad meets with state leaders to work out a roadmap. Hariprasad attempts to unite the Congress and set up an organizational structure. Multiple predecessors of Hariprasad have also made such attempts. No CLP leader is appointed due to tussle between the party factions.

title: Amid RSS-linked magazine row, Rahul, Vijayan slam Sangh Parivar for ‘targeting’ Christians after Waqf push
story_summary: Rahul Gandhi and Pinarayi Vijayan criticize Sangh Parivar for targeting Christians after passing the Waqf Amendment Bill. A now-deleted article in RSS-linked magazine claimed the Catholic Church is the largest non-governmental land owner. Rahul claimed that it didn't take long for the RSS to turn its attention to Christians. The article alleged missionary schools lure economically weaker sections. Kerala CM called the reference to wealth of Church an ominous indication. BJP national spokesperson said that The Catholic Church has not grabbed anyone’s land.

title: Today in Politics: Kerala and Bengal battlelines drawn as CPM set to pick next general secretary
story_summary: CPI(M) to pick its next general secretary, with M A Baby and Ashok Dhawale as contenders. Baby has backing of Kerala unit, while Dhawale is pitched by a section for focusing on rural issues. Concerns exist over CPI(M)'s role in INDIA bloc with Baby at helm, given the party's clash with Congress in Kerala. Previous instances of battle lines drawn between Kerala and West Bengal lobbies in the party have occurred in the past. BJP will celebrate its 45th foundation day and Amit Shah to tour Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Amid disquiet among RLD Muslim faces, how the party is looking to ride Waqf storm
story_summary: RLD leader Shahzeb Rizvi resigned in protest against party chief Jayant Chaudhary's support for the Waqf Amendment Bill, highlighting disquiet among some Muslim leaders. The RLD enjoyed Jat and Muslim backing in West UP, now part of the NDA after leaving the INDIA bloc.  Muslim leaders express unease, fearing loss of community support. While RLD claims benefits for Muslims, some leaders consider resigning. The party faces a prospect of upsetting Muslims due to it's Waqf support. RLD aims to balance loss with BJP votes in West UP.

title: SGPC to Akal Takht, AAP to SAD, key Punjab players up in arms against Waqf Bill, corner BJP
story_summary: Sikh bodies in Punjab, including SAD, oppose the Waqf Amendment Bill, deeming it discriminatory against Muslims. The ruling AAP and Congress staunchly oppose the Waqf Bill, isolating the BJP in the state.  SGPC demands the withdrawal of amended Waqf Bill. Muslim and Sikh organizations unite against the Waqf legislation. The AAP government opposes the Waqf Bill. Punjab Waqf Board manages estimated 75,965 properties. BJP struggles to connect with rural masses due to farmer’s agitations and poll defeats.

title: JD(U) rumblings over Waqf grow louder as 5 Muslim faces quit; party unfazed
story_summary: Five Bihar Muslim leaders resigned from JD(U) in protest against its support for the Waqf Amendment Bill. JD(U) downplays the resignations, calling them inconsequential. JD(U) claims prominent Muslim leaders haven't resigned. The party claims the Bill incorporates their views and protect the minority interests. More Muslim faces may quit, eroding JD(U)’s Muslim base ahead of the Assembly elections. JD(U) highlights its efforts for Muslim education and health. Minority interest is duly protected by our leader Nitish Kumar, said Anjum Ara.
